ReviewList.Text: Yet another of the countless Fifty Shades of Gray imitators, this one is actually pretty good. The author is quite talented, as I found her writing refined and polished, and the story flowed along nicely. The character of Zoe is developed fairly well, but Dawson doesn't allow us much of himself until late in the book, perhaps to keep the 'mystery man' persona alive. Their sexual encounters are presented well, but most fall just a little short of my expectations. In other words, most of the time the fireworks weren't as explosive as I was hoping for. The ending leaves the door wide open for a sequel, which I'll probably read. Overall, I liked the book and would say 3.5 stars are about right.
This was a complete, standalone novella, with a HEA ending. Would have enjoyed more interaction between the protagonists, but overall it was an enjoyable, well-edited read.

If you are looking for a story you won't really find it in this book. It is simply a fun, hot short story to get you a little horny but you shouldn't expect anything more. No getting to know the characters or empathize with any of them. Pure short term fun. It also doesn't seem very realistic in how fast Zoe finds herself engaging in these sort of sexual encounters after having a pretty mundane sex life before she met Dawson. Everything happens too fast and it feels unreal actually. Like a nice housewife fantasy which could only last until she gets off....Gotta hand it to the author though, the writing of the scenes is very powerful and it does make you feel hot. So for this purpose it's a nice read. Enjoy.
Just another highly abusive rich guy and the stupid girl who thinks she deserves it.

Relating to Zoe was easy being a female with some work experiences where I trained a number of young men to take positions over me and felt so much in a dead end job working for some ass.  Her solution was way out there and Dawson's reaction was somewhat of a surprise.  He was watchful and careful of her when he was punishing her and let her explore new aspects of her sexuality, which she needed.  I loved the ending, although it did open up the possibility for another book about these two without being a cliffhanger.  Yeah!  Dawson understood the part of Zoe's personality he triggered with 'If You Dare' challenges.

I thought this was supposed to be a BDSM romance except there was no romance in it. Dawson was not romantic, he was abusive. I didn't understand the whole sex club scene and am still not sure about the women who come and go from his office. What kind of company do they work for? Are they in a relationship now? Are the women still going to come to his office? Too many unanswered questions.
Not much for the mind to imagine sexually mayb book 2 is better

I don't read these kind of books a lot. Maybe once in a while. To make room for other genre like horror and stuff. But I liked this book. Almost every book I read has the same storyline but this one was a bit different and I'm glad. For that image it a 5 star. Read this book if your into 50 shades of gray. As it also has punishment and subs.

I know this is free. And I only downloaded it because it has a lot of stars. But, what the heck????? The storyline is awful. Female lead is silly. Male isn't really dominant. The only boosting about the book is that the author's writing is good enough to tell a bad story well. She's good at her craft.

I loved the fact that this book took a little of a different turn as far as the whole sexy billionaire theme has gone with the employee blackmailing her boss and then again with them attending the party as another twist that is not normally in most stories, thats what makes this book a 4 to me.

This story was very predictable and even as a novella, I felt as though it was too wordy.  The character development wasn't introduced early enough in the novel. I found myself bored as I read & forced myself to finish this story. It left me not wanting the more that was offered at the end.

Twists and turns, will keep you going with this. When you thought you had it figured out and hoped for some more you get it. A receptionist who is ignored by her boss takes an extreme measure and ends up winning big. If you like suspense and love a Dom, who gives a little you'll like this.

Erotic sex scenes, but I didn't like the lack of connection that the two leads failed to show, which was further punctuated by the derogatory words the male lead called the lady lead. I can only hope that the next installment brings more of an emotional connection between the two.

Difficult to put down...and I highly recommend it. Some parts were more difficult to read due to content (at least for me), but I found those parts written in  way (not sure how to describe it) that they were not as uncomfortable as I'd expected and I got through it easily.
